image.altText: Two uniformed police officers stand in tall yellow grass next to a badly damaged motorcycle caught in a chicken wire fence.

props.synopsis: A 57-year-old Canberra man dies after losing control and colliding with a tree on Tidbinbilla Road. His death is the ACT's fifth road fatality this year.

title.children: Police allegedly saw group of motorcyclists speeding before fatal crash

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly "stormed a home" and threatened a mother and son with a taser while demanding prescription drugs and cash will remain in custody.

title.children: Man allegedly 'stormed home' armed with taser and threatened mother and son

image.altText: Chenice Jordan

props.synopsis: Female participation in rugby league across the Canberra region has reached a record high. Despite this, both women's teams in Queanbeyan have been forced to fold mid-season due to a player shortage.

title.children: The footy club with a $600,000 female change room but no women's team

image.altText: A teenage boy holding a softball bat and glove, looking sad.

props.synopsis: It was a schoolyard sport so common it once rivalled cricket as the most popular in Australia. But now grassroots teams are struggling to fill a team sheet.

title.children: Australia were world champs, now teams are scrambling for players

image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue blazer.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC under a freedom of information request reveal that a complaint about Leanne Castley was formally lodged on June 25, though it was later withdrawn.

title.children: Complaint lodged then withdrawn against ACT Opposition Leader

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: A prisoner has been sentenced to additional jail time, after admitting to biting off part of the ear of another inmate during a fight after a volleyball game.

title.children: Prisoner sentenced after biting off inmate's ear after volleyball game

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist?

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: Sussan Ley in press conference

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley raises the case of a trans child abuser as she seeks to pressure the Albanese government to create mandatory minimum jail terms for child exploitation offences.

title.children: Coalition tries to wedge Labor on mandatory child abuse sentencing

image.altText: Lawrence Wong, a Singaporean man smiles while wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Singapore wants to expand its military ties with Australia, including through a greater Australian troop presence in the island state as part of an upgraded trade and defence relationship, according to Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.

title.children: Singapore PM warns of 'huge consequences' in ending current world order

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marks the two years since the Hamas-led attacks on Israel that killed more than 1,200 people, calling today "a day of pain and terror for Jewish people around the world". Follow live.

title.children: Albanese and Ley mark two years since October 7 attack

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Today not the day for protest': Marles
Albanese, Ley mark two years since October 7 attack

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: New legislation will be introduced to enshrine the powers of the Triple Zero Custodian into law.

title.children: Telcos face Canberra grilling as bill to improve triple-0 system is introduced

image.altText: A composite image of Megan Fox, Joshua Elmes, Alicia Montebello and Lucus Garzoli

props.synopsis: A coroner determines that the sole survivor of a crash that killed four people at Bochara was behind the wheel during the incident.

title.children: Coroner's warning on crash that killed adult and three teens

image.altText: A firefighter carries a hiker out on his back in the dark, with a group of people using head torches.

props.synopsis: Villagers have joined rescue crews in attempting to save those who have become stuck in heavy snow on Mount Everest in Tibet.

title.children: Hundreds of hikers still missing after Mount Everest blizzard

image.altText: A man in a suit holds a press conference with a concerned expression.

props.synopsis: Mr Lecornu stepped down just 14 hours after naming his Cabinet, plunging France into another political crisis.

title.children: Macron gives French PM days to save administration after snap resignation

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and a blue shirt standing in a Melbourne laneway

props.synopsis: GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients, according to an industry survey.

title.children: This GP says fees will go up at his clinic when bulk-billing incentives come in

image.altText: The supermoon as it rises over Mt Coot-tha in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Our skies will be graced by up to four consecutive supermoons over the next months. Here's why they happen, and how we can end up with multiple supermoons in a row.

title.children: Harvest moon kicks off a season of supermoons. Here's how to see them

image.altText: An empty potato shelf at Woolworths in South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australia produces 80 per cent of Australia's fresh potatoes, but extreme weather and drought across the state are causing a major shortage.

title.children: Customers face empty shelves as farmers battle potato shortage

image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: Users have reported Facebook's AI search has shown incorrect information about four-year-old Gus who remains missing in SA's outback.

title.children: Expert cautions AI use as it gives misinformation about missing SA boy

image.altText: Firefighters battling urban bushfire

props.synopsis: New research from Australian researchers shows, globally, major bushfire events are becoming more frequent, fatal and economically damaging.

title.children: Australia's south coast 'very, very high risk' for bushfires, modelling shows

image.altText: A smaller Kangaroo stands in front of a larger kangaroo in high grass.

props.synopsis: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

title.children: Kangaroos add pressure on drought-hit farmers by eating scarce feed

image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: A man who says he was threatened after investigating sovereign citizens says the movement should be labelled a terrorist organisation, but an academic argues this could lead to more violence.

title.children: Would declaring sovereign citizens 'terrorists' reduce violence, or fuel it?

image.altText: A sign with a photo of Epstein and Maxwell, urging peole to call if they have been a victim, is pointed to.

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court declines to hear Ghislaine Maxwell's bid to overturn her conviction for helping the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sexually abuse teenage girls.

title.children: US court declines Ghislaine Maxwell appeal against sex trafficking conviction

image.altText: A woman in a pantsuit sits on a chair next to a table of books.

props.synopsis: The author was best known for The Rutshire Chronicles, including the novel Rivals, which was recently adapted into a Disney+ series.

title.children: Jilly Cooper, English author known for her 'bonkbusters' dies at age 88

image.altText: A woman sits a court deck.

props.synopsis: Less than a year after the landmark trial which shook the world, Gisèle Pelicot will once again brave a courtroom as one of her rapists appeals his sentence.

title.children: Gisèle Pelicot to face rapist once again in French appeals case

image.altText: An image of Callan Park, a sandstone building with parkland, in the background + two old black and white pics of the building.

props.synopsis: The challenge of transforming a major piece of Sydney's public space from a former mental health hospital to an "iconic urban parkland" is a delicate dance for the state government.

title.children: Psychiatric hospital to 'urban parkland': Sydney's public space dilemma

image.altText: A PowerPoint showing the three scientists with their faces, biography and a headshot

props.synopsis: The Nobel Prize for Medicine has been given to three scientists for discovering how our immune systems protect us from microbes.

title.children: Trio of scientists win Nobel Prize in Medicine for work on immune system

image.altText: a small bird

props.synopsis: The song of the noisy scrub-bird is being heard in WA's West Cape Howe National Park again, bringing joy to bird enthusiasts everywhere.

title.children: Songbird heard for first time since 1890s in WA park

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: Victoria's prison population has surged by 62 per cent in the last 20 years as the number of accused held on remand triples.

title.children: Rise in Victoria's prisoner numbers outpace population growth

image.altText: Workers in high-vis use handheld drills to break through a large slab of concrete

props.synopsis: The number of people killed in the disaster could still rise, with some half a dozen children still unaccounted for.

title.children: At least 63 killed in Indonesian school collapse with others still missing

image.altText: A portrait of Scott McDougall wearing a suit jacket, white shirt and light blue tie in front of a green background.

props.synopsis: Queensland's outgoing human rights commissioner says he has lost sleep worrying about some juveniles "spending weeks and weeks" in the state's watch houses.

title.children: Boy's 'haunting' expression in watch house drives home concerns for commissioner

image.altText: Erin Patterson with glasses on and head down gets into a van outside court

props.synopsis: Victoria's Director of Public Prosecutions will appeal the sentence handed down to convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson.

title.children: Prosecutors to appeal 'manifestly inadequate' sentence for Erin Patterson

image.altText: a woman with brown hair in a lab coat

props.synopsis: Tasmanian TAFE graduates worry as some locally taught courses that helped them forge a career may disappear as the cost to study them increases dramatically.

title.children: From $4,000 to $21,000 — lab training in Tasmania could be a thing of the past

image.altText: Lawrence Wong, a Singaporean man smiles while wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Singapore's Prime Minister, Lawrence Wong, offers his condolences to the families of four Australians who died during an Optus network technical failure last month, which impacted hundreds of triple-0 calls.

title.children: Singapore PM gives condolences to families impacted by Optus outage deaths

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: Optus customers have come forward to report more cases of triple-0 calls failing outside the embattled telcos previously admitted outages.

title.children: Optus customers left angry after more failed triple-0 calls

image.altText: GettyImages-2239364328

props.synopsis: Lando Norris says anyone who criticised his driving at the Singapore Grand Prix "shouldn't be in F1", after Oscar Piastri openly criticised Norris's driving.

title.children: 'Shouldn't be in F1': Norris hits back at critics after Piastri incident
